discussion.content:
Do not include a header row in your CSV file, we should remove line 01: so the answer is B. No.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepointmigration/how-to-format-your-csv-file-for-data-content-migration

comments.content:
Ignore the above. 
Agree with Player1. Answer is B

discussion.content:
It should be A. 
UNC path should be provided and not local file path.

Not sure what LauraLaura means, whether she agrees or not with the answer.

Anyway, B is definitely correct, because the csv has a header row (line 01) which is not allowed as stated in the referenced article.
In the online example referenced, it states that line 2 is migrating data from a local file share, and line 3 is migrating from on-premises. But the question never mentions a file share.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You have a SharePoint Server farm and a SharePoint Online subscription.
You plan to perform a bulk migration by using the SharePoint Migration Tool.
You create the following CSV file. (Line numbers are included for reference only.)
//IMG//

You need to modify the CSV file to ensure that the bulk migration will complete successfully.
Solution: You change line 02 to use a UNC path instead of a local file path.
Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
The first part should be get-spenterprisesearchserviceapplication, see here:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/search/manage-continuous-crawls#to-change-the-continuous-crawl-interval
The first part should be get-spenterprisesearchserviceapplication, see here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepointmigration/overview-of-the-sharepoint-migration-assessment-tool

questions.question_text:
You need to implement the business goals for the HR department.
What should you do?

choices.D: Activate Content Type Syndication Hub. Update the Column default value settings for the document library.
choices.B: Add site columns to a document library. Save the document library as a template.
choices.A: Create a content type that contains site columns. Add the content type to the document libraries.
choices.C: Enable enterprise metadata and keywords for the document libraries.

discussion.content: A is correct. All of those are column names, which has nothing to do with managed metadata.

comments.content: I meant: *"Might be >>A<<, but B might also work."
There is no requirement or reusing the doc lib template. hence B is out

I would also say that C is NOT correct.

Not sure about the correct answer though. Might be C, but B might also work.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to meet the technical requirements for the external content types of the marketing department.
What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
I think all should be Execute only!
https://lightningtools.com/blog/business-connectivity-services-end-user-implications-part-three-external-content-type-authorisation-errors
that case HR must be read, then Execute will grant write also..

Research department users should be "Execute only".
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/manage-business-connectivity-service-applications

comments.content:
Users in the research department must be able to read and write data.
So, "Edit and Execute" is right
Per the definition in the MSFT docs, the Execute permission already allows read and write data in the ETCs. The Edit permission is for manipulating the external systems and DBC models.
Agree, look at the first step "synchronizing your user accounts" in this link https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/hybrid/configure-hybrid-onedrive-for-businessroadmap

discussion.content: I think the correct answer is D. hybrid Microsoft OneDrive for Business
